How We Turned Sustainability Into Growth: Insights from the 2025 Green Growth Programme

By Ryan Laird 6 November 2025
#space sustainability

Sustainability is no longer a peripheral concern for businesses‚Äîit has become a strategic imperative. At Green Orbit Digital, we were proud to participate in the 2025 Green Growth Programme, a free six-week initiative run by Small Business Britain in partnership with BT. Designed specifically for SMEs, the programme equips businesses with the knowledge, tools, and confidence to leverage sustainability as a driver of financial performance, operational efficiency, and brand reputation.

Our participation offered hands-on learning, peer exchange, and actionable insights that are directly relevant to our work helping clients in the space, technology, and high-tech sectors communicate their sustainability stories and integrate eco-conscious practices across their operations.

Making the Business Case for Sustainability

The programme opened on 18th September with an exploration of the business rationale for sustainability. Drawing on evidence from the Willow Review, participants examined how sustainability initiatives can translate into tangible business benefits: reducing costs through energy efficiency, enhancing resilience against supply chain shocks, and strengthening competitive positioning.

For Green Orbit, this session underscored a critical lesson: sustainability is not just about environmental stewardship‚Äîit is a strategic lever for growth. We reflected on how clients in the space sector, for example, can integrate sustainable practices into satellite manufacturing, launch planning, and operational protocols, and how these actions, when communicated clearly, enhance both credibility and stakeholder confidence.

‚ÄúSustainability isn‚Äôt just about doing good‚Äîit‚Äôs about doing well. The right actions create value for the planet, your customers, and your bottom line.‚Äù ‚Äì Ryan Laird, Director, Green Orbit Digital

Quick Wins: Practical Sustainability Actions

The session on 25th September focused on quick wins for SMEs, highlighting the 5-point plan for immediate action. Low-cost interventions such as optimising energy use, reducing paper and plastic consumption, and implementing smarter procurement strategies were presented as high-impact measures with immediate returns.

At Green Orbit, we took these lessons and applied them internally: upgrading office systems to more energy-efficient alternatives, reducing travel emissions through virtual meetings, and streamlining procurement to favour sustainable suppliers. Beyond operational improvements, these actions inform our client advisory work, allowing us to guide SMEs on practical sustainability measures that are credible, measurable, and communicable through marketing channels.

Harnessing AI and Digital Tools for Sustainability

The 2nd October session explored the role of AI and digital technologies in achieving sustainability goals. From energy monitoring systems to AI-driven logistics optimisation, digital tools can deliver efficiency gains while reducing environmental impact.

For Green Orbit, the session provided actionable insights into how technology intersects with marketing and communications. Using AI and analytics, we can track and showcase sustainability progress for clients, identify opportunities to reduce resource use, and support campaigns that demonstrate genuine impact rather than superficial claims. This capability strengthens both operational performance and brand narrative.

Marketing Green: Communicating Sustainability Authentically

On 9th October, the focus shifted to marketing sustainability effectively. Consumers today expect transparency and authenticity, and poorly communicated sustainability efforts risk reputational damage. The session emphasised storytelling, clear messaging, and aligning brand values with actionable commitments.

This aligns seamlessly with Green Orbit‚Äôs mission. We help clients articulate their sustainability journey in ways that are credible, compelling, and measurable. Whether highlighting low-carbon initiatives, community engagement, or innovative eco-solutions, communicating authentically allows businesses to attract ethically conscious customers, strengthen stakeholder trust, and differentiate in competitive markets.

Financing Sustainable Growth

The 16th October session provided SMEs with insights into financial tools for sustainability, including grants, loans, and green finance mechanisms. Understanding how to access funding is essential to scale initiatives beyond small pilot projects.

Green Orbit now integrates this perspective into our advisory services, helping clients identify financing opportunities for sustainable projects and develop communications that appeal to investors, partners, and customers. Sustainability becomes not only a moral imperative but a business opportunity backed by financial planning.

Planning for Long-Term Impact

The final session on 23rd October addressed sustaining gains over time. Participants learned how to track progress, maintain momentum, and remain connected with sustainability networks and support systems.

For Green Orbit, long-term planning is central to our approach. By combining strategic planning, ongoing measurement, and responsible communications, we help clients ensure their sustainability initiatives are durable, measurable, and aligned with brand purpose. Whether tracking carbon reductions, reporting on ethical sourcing, or documenting community engagement, consistent communication strengthens both impact and credibility.

Green Orbit‚Äôs Key Takeaways

Participation in the Green Growth Programme has reinforced several principles that underpin our work at Green Orbit Digital:

  • Sustainability initiatives deliver tangible business value when strategically planned and executed.
  • Responsible communications are essential for credibility, customer engagement, and brand differentiation.
  • Accessing funding and leveraging technology amplifies sustainability efforts and ensures scalability.
  • Long-term impact relies on measurement, reporting, and continuous improvement, supported by robust marketing strategies.

‚ÄúSustainability is only as powerful as the story you tell about it. At Green Orbit, we help organisations act responsibly, communicate responsibly, and grow responsibly.‚Äù ‚Äì Ryan Laird, Director

Take Action: Build Your Sustainable Growth Strategy

The 2025 Green Growth Programme has now reached full capacity, but SMEs can sign up to be the first to hear about the next round. At Green Orbit Digital, we partner with businesses to turn sustainability into growth through actionable strategies, credible marketing, and measurable results.

üìß Contact us: hello@greenorbit.space

üåê Learn more: greenorbit.space

Sustainability is not optional‚Äîit is essential. With the right guidance, tools, and communications strategy, businesses can grow responsibly, inspire change, and create long-term value for people, planet, and profit.

Impact Orbit Creative Group

Impact Orbit Creative Group is a multi-disciplinary consultancy and innovation hub focused on driving sustainable growth, digital transformation, and impact-led strategies in the space and technology sectors. We partner with organisations and startups worldwide to deliver strategic guidance, communications expertise, and frameworks for responsible innovation.
